summary: Run MLkit release
description:
Title
Create new mlkit release to deliver latest features and update lifecycle configuration

Value Statement
As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who maintains shared tools, I need to create a new mlkit release in the repo, verify Jenkins pipelines execute successfully in each environment, and update the lifecycle configuration so that tenants can reliably use the latest version.

Acceptance Criteria

A new mlkit release is created in the repo.
Jenkins pipelines execute successfully in each environment and publish the new version.
The new mlkit version is available in all supported environments.
The lifecycle configuration (LCC) is updated to reference the new version.

summary: Research and Prototype eMPWR AI Use Case Integration
description:
*Value Statement*

As a member of the BIP AI Team, I want to research and prototype the functionality required for the eMPWR AI Use case, so that we can determine the LOE and feasibility of their delivery.

*Acceptance Criteria*
 * Research the AI Use Case and functionality - Kafka, Bedrock
 * Prototype basic integration of the functionality on BIP AI
 * Prepare findings to report to the eMPWR team

*Assumptions*

None

*Dependencies*

None

*Notes*

None

*Out of Scope*

None

summary: Configure HTTP ingress for deployed MCPs
description:

AC: 
-Deployed endpoint can be reached from within SBX environment.
-Notebook created that interacts with deployed MCP

summary: Create CE agent that aligns with tenant needs

AC: Example notebook in tenant resources demonstrating CE MCP

summary: Create template for deployed MCPs
description:
As an MLE developing MCPs, I want an initial template Helm chart created to easily deploy new MCPs consistently while building a foundation for best practices.

 

AC: 
 - Template Helm charts created that define secrets, & ingress in different deployment environments 
 - A template Helm chart exists with the following components:
 ** {{Chart.yaml}} and {{values.yaml}} scaffolding
 ** Environment-specific values files ({{{}values-sbx.yaml{}}})
 ** Core templates for Deployment, Service, Ingress, and ExternalSecret

summary: Authentication for deployed MCPs
description:

AC: 
- Research done to find best way to handle auth in deployments
- Authentication key needed to reach deployed MCP

summary: Finalize demo for Playwright MCP and automated testing

However, before finalizing, need to make sure the updated Playwright MCP Git repository is updated with a working official Playwright MCP configuration with actual MCP tools instead of using a custom MCP server with custom tools.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Update Playwright MCP Git repository with a working official Playwright MCP configuration with actual MCP tools.
- Create final presentation of Playwright MCP and demo as required.

Assumptions
None

Dependencies
None

Notes
None

Acceptance: Criteria Add starter Git repository and Confluence document.

Acceptance Criteria

summary: Add custom JupyterLab image with required dependencies for dev core domain to simplify environment configuration
description:
Value Statement
As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who manages environments, I need the ability to build and use a custom JupyterLab image with all necessary dependencies so that tenant resources notebooks and mlkit runs reliably in the dev core domain.

Acceptance Criteria

Working off of the "custom-studio-image" branch in bip-ai-kit repo, the Dockerfile is updated to include all dependencies for tenant resources, mlkit, and other previously installed packages.
The custom image is built and attached in the dev core domain in the dev environment.
Manual validation: Confirm tenant resources notebooks execute successfully using the custom image.

summary: Research Bedrock Prompt Mgmt in Console and note requirements, usecases, and access in Confluence
description:
Value Statement: As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who supports tenant workflows, I need the ability to research AWS Prompt Management and document requirements, use cases, and recommendations so that tenants can appropriately implement prompt management to save, access, and manage prompts.

Acceptance Criteria When research is completed, it includes detailed information on AWS Prompt Management, including requirements, use cases, and best practices. Documentation is created in Confluence following the technical documentation template. Recommendations are tailored to tenant needs. Provide references to relevant AWS documentation for further tenant exploration.

summary: Delete unused LCCs in sbx and dev core domains
description:
Value Statement
As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who manages domain configurations, I need the ability to remove unused lifecycle configurations and attach the correct default so that environments remain clean and consistent.

Acceptance Criteria

When unused lifecycle configurations are identified in sbx and dev core domains, they are deleted.
The correct lifecycle configuration is attached as the default in each domain.
Manual validation: Confirm only the correct default LCC is present in sbx and dev core domains.

summary: Debug inference profiles issues with KB and Agents
description:
Value Statement
As a BIP AI Tenant who uses Bedrock Agents and Knowledge Bases, I need the ability to use inference profiles reliably so that I can invoke models without errors and follow platform requirements.

Acceptance Criteria

When a user runs tenant resources notebooks for Agents and Knowledge Bases with inference profiles, model invocation works as expected.
Issues with inference profiles are diagnosed and addressed for both Agents and Knowledge Bases.
Manual validation: Confirm successful usage of inference profiles in the relevant tenant resources notebooks.

summary: Build tenant resources notebook for basic AWS Lambda usage
description:
Value Statement
As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who supports AWS AI workflows, I need the ability to utilize and provide examples for Lambda functions so that tenants can easily configure Lambda functions to use with Bedrock agents and more.

Acceptance Criteria
When a tenant needs to implement Lambda functions in their workflow, they can refer to the example notebook in the tenant resources repo to streamline the setup process. 
Notebook includes how to invoke and update a Lambda function through the SDK. Includes how to run Bedrock agents through Lambda functions. Also includes how to troubleshoot common errors and links to useful documentation.

summary: Change notebooks to include environment name in resource names
description:
Title Update notebooks to include environment name in resource names

Value Statement

As a BIP AI Tenant who creates resources via notebooks, I need the ability to include the environment name in resource names so that resources are easily identified and managed across environments.

Acceptance Criteria

When a user runs a tenant resources notebook, all created resources include the environment name in their names. Manual validation: Confirm resource names reflect the environment for each notebook.

summary: attach LCC for editor for all domains in dev, stage, and preprod
description:
Value Statement
As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who manages environments, I need the ability to apply code editor lifecycle configurations to all SageMaker domains in dev, stage, and preprod so that users have a consistent setup.

Acceptance Criteria

When the Jenkins pipeline runs, the code editor lifecycle configuration is attached to all SageMaker domains in dev, stage, and preprod.
Manual validation: Confirm configuration is applied to each domain.

summary: Enable inference profiles for every tenant in dev, stage, preprod
description:
Value Statement
As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who manages tenant resources, I need the ability to enable Bedrock inference profiles for every tenant in dev, stage, and preprod so that model invocation is standardized across environments.

Acceptance Criteria

When a new tenant is onboarded or updated, a Bedrock inference profile is enabled for them in dev, stage, and preprod.
Manual validation: Confirm inference profiles exist for each tenant in all environments.

summary: Update Bedrock notebooks to use inference profiles for model invocation
description:
Value Statement
As a BIP AI Tenant who runs Bedrock model notebooks, I need the ability to use inference profiles instead of model IDs so that model invocation aligns with platform standards.

Acceptance Criteria

When a user opens a Bedrock notebook, model invocation uses an inference profile (not a model ID).
Notebooks include comments explaining that inference profiles must be requested via a BIP AI support ticket.
Inference profile fields are set as empty strings by default.
Functionality is verified with an existing inference profile.

summary: Determine process for API Gateway configuration with SageMaker Endpoints to enable tenant integration
description:
Value Statement
As a BIP AI MLOps Engineer who supports tenant integrations, I need to define the process for configuring API Gateway with SageMaker Endpoints so that tenants can connect their models to applications.

Acceptance Criteria

When the process is determined, BIP AI engineers have clear steps to configure API Gateway with SageMaker Endpoints (documented in Confluence)
Manual validation: Confirm process enables successful integration for a test case.

summary: Unified endpoint deployment Jenkins pipeline
description:
Value Statement:
As a MLOPs engineer who deploys models for tenants, I need the ability to create a unified deployment pipeline the solution engineers can use for their respective tenants

Acceptance Criteria:
When a solutions engineer needs to a deploy a model for a tenant, they can utilize the unified deployment pipeline, instead of a custom built pipeline. 

Note: Probably a good idea to take a look at all existing deployment pipelines, and sync w/ SE's before building

summary: Add Grafana alert based on bedrock usage
description:
Value Statement
As a BIP AI Tenant who monitors Bedrock usage, I need the ability to receive Slack alerts when usage exceeds 5 million tokens so that I can proactively manage resource consumption.

Acceptance Criteria

When Bedrock usage reaches 5 million tokens, a Grafana alert is sent to the designated Slack channel. (start w/ EVA and SPA)
Manual validation: Confirm alert triggers and is received in Slack.

summary: Troubleshoot Bedrock Access Policy Issues
description:
As a member of the BIP-AI infrastructure team, I need to troubleshoot Bedrock access policy issues that are blocking calls from SageMaker Studio to ensure consistent access to Bedrock resources across all tenants.

A/C:

When Bedrock access policies are investigated, then the root cause of blocked calls to Bedrock resources (including inference profiles) from SageMaker Studio should be identified and documented.
When policy inconsistencies between tenants are analyzed, then a solution should be implemented to ensure all tenants have proper and consistent access to Bedrock resources through SageMaker Studio.

summary: Solve Jenkins BIP-AI Issue
description:
As a member of the BIP-AI infrastructure team, I need to resolve the Jenkins permission naming issue on the bip-ai domain to ensure proper access control for infrastructure team members.

A/C:

When the Jenkins configuration is investigated, then the root cause of why permissions are being created with "bip-bip-ai-" naming instead of the expected "bip-ai-" naming convention should be identified and corrected.
When the permission naming is fixed to use "bip-ai-*" format, then all infrastructure team members should regain proper access and permissions to perform their required tasks on the bip-ai Jenkins instance.

description:

- Request a new EntraID Group from VA, which will form the basis for cluster permissions for the infra team. Follow the established naming convention and be integrated with the existing RBAC framework for BIP infrastructure.
- When the EntraID Group are provisioned, more work will be done to integrate teh EntraID group in following stories.

2. Document its findings (both authentication and authorization). Document how well the whitespace in EntraID group name works for authorization.

summary: Prototype Bedrock IaC Promotion
description:
As a member of the BIP-AI infrastructure team, I need to prototype the promotion process for Bedrock Agents from DEV to Production to establish a reliable deployment pipeline for AI infrastructure components.

A/C:

When the Bedrock IaC promotion prototype is developed, then it should demonstrate how Bedrock Agents can be safely promoted through environments (DEV → PROD) with proper validation and rollback capabilities.
When the prototype identifies promotion requirements across BIP-AI platform components (including gateway integration), then follow-up stories should be created to address each identified area and ensure comprehensive coverage of the promotion workflow.

Develop deep pause front-end buttons on all resources vue
description:
User Story: Add Deep Pause and Deep Resume Buttons to AllResources Vue Component
Title
Add Deep Pause and Deep Resume UI controls to Crossplane All Resources view for hierarchical resource management

Description
Extend the existing AllResources.vue component by adding two new action buttons for "Deep Pause" and "Deep Resume" functionality. These buttons will be positioned alongside the existing Pause and Resume buttons in the action bar and will utilize the new deep pause/resume API endpoints to enable administrators to pause/resume entire resource hierarchies with a single click. The implementation will follow the existing UI patterns and provide appropriate visual feedback during operations.

Value Statement
By adding Deep Pause and Deep Resume buttons to the All Resources UI, administrators can efficiently manage complex resource hierarchies through the familiar web interface, reducing the need for manual command-line operations and providing immediate visual feedback on bulk operations across resource trees.

Acceptance Criteria
• Two new buttons ("Deep Pause" and "Deep Resume") are added to the action bar in AllResources.vue • Buttons are positioned logically near existing pause/resume controls with consistent styling • Deep Pause button integrates with new /deep-pause-resource API endpoint • Deep Resume button integrates with new /deep-resume-resource API endpoint • Buttons follow existing disabled state patterns when no resources are selected or operations are in progress • Loading states display "Deep Pausing..." and "Deep Resuming..." text during operations • Success notifications display detailed results including counts of successfully processed resources • Error handling displays specific failures with resource names while continuing operation • Buttons maintain accessibility standards with proper ARIA labels and keyboard navigation • Visual styling matches existing button design patterns (colors, hover states, focus rings) • Button tooltips provide clear descriptions of hierarchical functionality • Selected resource count is displayed in button text following existing pattern • All notifications follow existing notification patterns and durations

Definition of Done
• Deep Pause and Deep Resume buttons are implemented and functional in AllResources.vue • API integration correctly calls new deep pause/resume endpoints with proper payload structure • Error handling gracefully manages partial failures and displays meaningful user feedback • Loading states and disabled states work correctly during operations • UI follows existing design patterns and accessibility standards • Component maintains responsive design on different screen sizes • Manual testing confirms buttons work with various resource selection scenarios • Code follows existing Vue 3 composition API patterns used in the component • No regression issues with existing pause/resume functionality

Technical Notes
Leverage existing pauseSelectedResources and resumeSelectedResources functions as implementation templates
New functions should be named deepPauseSelectedResources and deepResumeSelectedResources
API endpoints will be /deep-pause-resource and /deep-resume-resource
Follow existing button styling with distinct visual indicators (consider icons like "layers" or "hierarchy")
Maintain existing isOperationInProgress state management pattern

summary: Develop deep pause API endpoint for Crossplane composite resources to enable hierarchical control
description:
Title: Develop deep pause API endpoint for Crossplane composite resources to enable hierarchical control

Description: Extend the existing pause/resume functionality by implementing a "deep pause" feature that allows administrators to pause a selected Crossplane composite resource and all of its child resources recursively. This backend functionality will programmatically traverse the resource hierarchy using composite resource references to identify and pause/resume all dependent resources in the chain. The implementation should leverage the existing pause/resume helper functions that handle the crossplane.io/paused=true annotation.

Value Statement: By implementing deep pause functionality, administrators gain the ability to quickly pause entire resource hierarchies with a single action, reducing operational complexity and potential for human error when managing complex composite resources with multiple dependencies.

Acceptance Criteria: 
• New FastAPI backend route is created for deep pause and deep resume operations 
• Function recursively identifies child resources using composite resource references 
• Deep pause operation traverses multiple levels of composite-to-composite relationships 
• Implementation utilizes existing pause/resume helper functions for individual resource annotation • Deep pause continues processing all resources even if individual resources fail to pause • Error handling reports specific resources that failed to pause/resume without stopping the operation 
• API response includes lists of successfully paused/resumed resources by plural/resource name 
• API response includes lists of failed resources with error details by plural/resource name 
• All operations (successes and failures) are logged for audit and debugging purposes 
• Deep resume operation reverses the pause state for all resources in the hierarchy 
• All resource types are included in deep pause operations (no exclusions) 
• Local testing is completed using Bruno API client against minikube cluster 
• Unit tests cover the recursive resource discovery logic and error handling scenarios 
• Integration tests validate end-to-end deep pause/resume functionality

Definition of Done: 
• FastAPI routes for deep pause and deep resume are implemented and functional 
• Recursive resource traversal logic is thoroughly tested 
• Error handling continues operation and reports failed resources appropriately 
• Response format includes detailed success/failure lists with resource identification 
• Comprehensive logging is implemented for all operations 
• All tests pass in local minikube environment 
• Bruno test collection is created and validates API functionality including error scenarios 
• Code is reviewed and meets team standards 
• Documentation includes API endpoint specifications, response format, and usage examples

summary: Update Gateway MFEs to use the Global Vue Import

summary: Write an AWS Lambda script to kill idle Sagemaker endpoints
description:
Value Statement
As a BIP AI Tenant who manages SageMaker endpoints, I need the ability to automatically terminate idle endpoints based on their last inference request so that I can reduce unnecessary costs and optimize resource usage.

Acceptance Criteria
When a SageMaker endpoint has been idle (no inference requests) for a configurable period, the Lambda function terminates the endpoint.
The Lambda function logs terminated endpoints and their last activity timestamps for audit purposes.
The Lambda function can be scheduled to run periodically using EventBridge.
The Lambda function uses the boto3 library for SageMaker and logs actions to CloudWatch.
Validation
Test the Lambda function with endpoints that have varying levels of activity to confirm it correctly identifies and terminates idle endpoints.
Verify that logs include accurate details of terminated endpoints and their last activity.
Ensure the Lambda function can be triggered on a schedule using EventBridge.

summary: Prototype Lambda IaC to support model deployment to enable lambda and API gateway self-service
description:
Summary
As a tenant of BIP-AI, I need a Crossplane composition that creates Lambda functions with IAM roles compatible with EKS or S3 code sources, so that I can deploy models as an alternative to SageMaker endpoints and prepare for future API Gateway integration.


Acceptance Criteria
 Functional Requirements
-  Create a standalone Crossplane composition that provisions:
  - AWS Lambda function
  - IAM role for Lambda execution
  - Support for ECR-based code sources
  - Support for S3-based code sources
  - Custom IAM policy attachment capability
-  Composition must support resources on a per-request basis for tenant flexibility (naming/multiples)
-  Successfully tested and validated in BIP SBX environment
-  Composite Resource Definition (CRD) schema includes:
  - Clear descriptions for all fields
  - Structure that supports future Gateway API/UI consumption
Technical Requirements
-  IAM role creation is included within the same composition (not external dependency)
-  Custom policy support through configurable parameters
-  Composition supports flexible configurations for future Gateway UI consumption
-  Resource definitions follow BIP-AI style
Documentation Requirements
-  CRD schema documented with field descriptions
-  Example claim YAML provided
-  Integration patterns with ECR and S3 documented
Definition of Done
-  Crossplane composition file created and validated
-  Crossplane claim template created and validated
-  Composite Resource Definition (CRD) implemented with descriptive schema
-  Test claim successfully provisions Lambda and IAM role in BIP SBX
-  Lambda function can access EKS-sourced container images
-  Lambda function can access S3-based code artifacts
-  Custom IAM policies can be attached via composition parameters
-  All resources clean up properly when claim is deleted
-  Code review completed and approved
-  Documentation updated in repository
-  Testing results documented and verified in SBX environment
Out of Scope
- Gateway UI integration (future enhancement)
- API Gateway claim deployment (future enhancement)
Technical Notes
- This composition should be designed with extensibility in mind for future API Gateway integration
- Schema design should prioritize clarity and ease of use for eventual UI consumption
- Ensure proper RBAC considerations for tenant isolation
Testing Strategy
- IaC Validator testing of composition logic
- Integration testing in BIP SBX environment
- Validation of IAM permissions and Lambda execution
- Testing of both ECR and S3 code source scenarios
- Cleanup testing to ensure no orphaned resources

summary: Update PROD deployment pipeline to work w/ new model
description:
Value Statement
As a SE who supports SPA, I need the ability to update the PROD deployment  pipeline to work w/ their new model so that we can hit the prod shadow deployment window.

Acceptance Criteria
When a user triggers the prod deployment pipeline the user has the ability to deploy an endpoint successfully to prod based on SPA's new model.

summary: Create lambda function based on SPA inference script
description:
As a SE who supports SPA, I need the ability to create a lambda function based on their inference script since the model is no longer a traditional ML model. We will need to serve it via API gateway instead of a sagemaker endpoint

Acceptance Criteria
When a user invokes the lambda function, the user has the ability to receive a response from the new SPA model

summary: Implement temporary Jenkins integration for SPA using their deploy script to meet model-pivot deadline
description:
Value Statement
As an SE supporting the SPA team during a major model pivot, I need the ability to invoke Jenkins pipelines from their new deploy script so that SPA can deploy endpoints and test across environments, ensuring we hit the deadline while the long-term solution is developed in parallel.


Acceptance Criteria
Jenkins and SageMaker Notebook runs are isolated: Jenkins runs can overwrite an endpoint of the same name, but notebook mode cannot; a flag must be created to differentiate modes.


Tests (e.g., black, pylint, coverage) are included in Jenkins runs
Security groups are pulled in as environment variables, not from config.yaml
SPA changes are merged into the Jenkins integration branch
Pipeline/scripts adapt to SPA changes without breaking deployments
Flask app can successfully establish connections with deployed endpoints in tested environments
Assumptions
This is a temporary/bridge solution to meet the model-pivot deadline.
The SPA team will continue using their deploy script during this interim period.

Dependencies
SPA team will be modifying scripts that must be adapted to as this ticket is worked on.
